content:
advertisement

Penn State World Campus officials have high hopes for increased enrollment this year as students from around the globe continue to register for Penn State courses PERIOD

 said Karen Lesch academic adviser for the World Campus PERIOD

Last year more than  students registered for World Campus courses she added PERIOD

World Campus offers students at the university and across the globe flexible scheduling options PERIOD

The kiosk in the HUBRobeson Center offers students a facetoface option to ease the online process PERIOD

The kiosk opened when the World Campus main offices moved last March from the Mitchell Building which is currently being demolished to Cato Park PERIOD

Since then students have taken advantage of the conveniences offered at the kiosk PERIOD

They can turn in assignments register for World Campus courses and pay registration fees at there said Jane Hyde student services registration staff assistant PERIOD

 Lesch said PERIOD

Most students taking courses through the World Campus are not Penn State students PERIOD Last year a man working in Antarctica took an Internet course to work toward a geographic information systems certificate PERIOD

Students who are taking World Campus courses recommend that others experience it but caution that an online course is not always easy PERIOD

 said Kelly Hale senioradvertisingpublic relations who is taking Communications 260W News Writing online this semester PERIOD

 Hale said PERIOD

Eric Pierce seniorfilm and video is currently taking his third online class PERIOD

Pierce said he first registered for an online course to have a more flexible schedule while still carrying a full course load but instead found that theory to be untrue PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Pierce said in addition to doing assignments students must also spend about the same amount of time they usually would be in class teaching themselves the material but the experience is worth it PERIOD
